revised_title: Observations of a Fire-Ball and Explosion in the Sky
tldr: In December 1741, Mr. Christopher Mason observed a dark, unusual appearance in the sky followed by a violent explosion and a ball of fire moving eastward. The event was witnessed by several people and heard as far away as Sompting, beyond Shoreham. Mason did not see any fire or lightning, and the event was discussed at a meeting of the Royal Society on January 7, 1742.
